instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936B: What is 820-2936B? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PPVBAT_G3H_CONN: What is PPVBAT_G3H_CONN? This is the where the batteryâ€™s power rail connects to the motherboard. .
definitions.PPVBAT_G3H_CHGR_R: What is PPVBAT_G3H_CHGR_R? This is a power rail between the battery and a current sense resistor before the battery power feeds current to the rest of the machine. .
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> It's not charging
threads.message: before me the <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> was modified. I changed it to be sure. I tried with 3 different batteries. The green light does not turn orange. The device turns on but does not charge. where should i start

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> It's not charging
threads.message:
Did you try disconnecting BIL (J6955)?
Check diode mode to ground at SCL/SDA lines of battery bus.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> It's not charging
threads.message:
Did you try disconnecting BIL (J6955)?   YES
SCL : 0.513
SDA: 0.512

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> It's not charging
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H_CHGR_R</SIGNAL>   &  <SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H_CONN</SIGNAL> : 10.54 voltage
<SIGNAL>CHGR_LGATE</SIGNAL> :. No voltage  is this normal ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> It's not charging
threads.message:
The battery is recognized in macOS, at least?
Exact <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage, without battery?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> It's not charging
threads.message:
There is a charging sign but the battery is not charging.
without battery  <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> : 4 voltage

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> It's not charging
threads.message:
So the machine doesn't work without battery?

Remove the battery and fix <SIGNAL>PPB_G3H</SIGNAL> problem first.
Check resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.
